parameters.description: The time it takes for the planet to complete one orbit around its star.
The time of the first transit in Barycentric Julian Date minus 2,455,000.
The eccentricity of the planet's orbit times the sine of the argument of periapsis.
The tilt of the planet's orbit in degrees relative to the line of sight.
The angle in the orbital plane from the reference direction to the ascending node.
The mass of the planet in Earth masses.

maar_world.reference: Orosz, J. A., et al. (2019). Priors for Fitting Parameters. In The Astronomical Journal, 157(174), Table 4.
